gurmukhi: ਸਕਲ ਸੁਗੰਧਤਾ ਮਿਲਤ ਅਰਗਜਾ ਹੋਤ ਕੋਟਿ ਅਰਗਜਾ ਮਿਲਿ ਬਿਸਮ ਸੁਬਾਸ ਕੈ
transliteration: Sakal Sougandhataa Milat Aragajaa Hota , Koti Aragajaa Mili Bisam Soubaas Kai ?
translation: When sandalwood, musk, camphor and saffron are mixed; a fragrant paste is formed, But millions of such pastes are worthless before the fragrance of the lotus like feet of Satguru Ji.

gurmukhi: ਸਕਲ ਅਨੂਪ ਰੂਪ ਕਮਲ ਬਿਖੈ ਸਮਾਤ ਹੇਰਤ ਹਿਰਾਤ ਕੋਟਿ ਕਮਲਾ ਪ੍ਰਗਾਸ ਕੈ
transliteration: Sakal Anoop Roop Kamal Bikhai Samaata , Hayrat Hiraat Koti Kamalaa Pragaas Kai ?
translation: All the beauties of the world are absorbed in Lakshmi (the consort of Vishnu) but the beautiful radiance of Lord's feet is many times more blissful and pleasant than millions of Lakshmis,

gurmukhi: ਸਰਬ ਨਿਧਾਨ ਮਿਲਿ ਪਰਮ ਨਿਧਾਨ ਭੲੇ ਕੋਟਿਕ ਨਿਧਾਨ ਹੁੲਿ ਚਕਿਤ ਬਿਲਾਸ ਕੈ
transliteration: Sarab Nidhaan Mili Param Nidhaan Bhaay , Kotik Nidhaan Hui Chakit Bilaas Kai ?
translation: The wealth of the world put together becomes supreme and invaluable assets. But all the peace and comforts obtainable from many times more wealth is not even a counterpart of the comforts obtained from the spiritual bliss of the Lord,

gurmukhi: ਚਰਨ ਕਮਲ ਗੁਰ ਮਹਿਮਾ ਅਗਾਧਿ ਬੋਧਿ ਗੁਰਸਿਖ ਮਧੁਕਰ ਅਨਭੈ ਅਭਿਅਾਸ ਕੈ ||੬੬||
transliteration: Charan Kamal Gur Mahimaa Agaadhi Bodhi , Gursikh Madhoukar Anabhai Abhiaas Kai ?66?
translation: The glory of the lotus feet of a True Guru is beyond the perception of a man. The devoted Sikhs enjoy and relish the elixir of the lotus feet of Fearless God through engrossing themselves in Naam Simran. (66)
